symptoms.name: Desquamation
symptoms.pattern: 1-2 weeks after onset, particularly on palms and soles

symptoms.name: Hypotension
symptoms.severity: Systolic blood pressure ≤ 90 mm Hg for adults or <5th percentile for children <16 years

vital_signs.blood_pressure: Systolic blood pressure ≤ 90 mm Hg (adults) or <5th percentile (children <16 years)

physical_findings: Desquamation of palms and soles (1-2 weeks after onset)

lab_values.blood_culture: May be positive for Staphylococcus aureus
lab_values.other_cultures: Positive cultures from normally sterile sites (blood, CSF, joint fluid, etc.) or non-sterile sites (throat, vagina, sputum)

risk_factors: Use of birth control devices (diaphragms, contraceptive sponges)

required: Hypotension (systolic blood pressure ≤ 90 mm Hg for adults or <5th percentile for children <16 years)
Desquamation (1-2 weeks after onset, particularly on palms and soles)
supportive: Positive blood culture for Staphylococcus aureus
Positive cultures from other normally sterile or non-sterile sites
